channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chinese Shares End Lower, Weighed by Energy, Pharma Stocks
item.description: Chinese shares ended lower, with energy stocks falling after both Cnooc and Sinopec reported lower revenues amid soft crude oil prices.

item.title: Boeing raises greater-than-expected $21 billion from new stock sales
item.description: The Boeing Co. said Tuesday it will raise almost $21 billion from the capital raise announced Monday through public offerings of common stock and depo...

item.title: Want Americans to be healthier? Offer universal paid family leave, pediatrician group says
item.description: Paid family and medical leave “has the power to improve an entire generation’s health,” American Academy of Pediatrics says.

item.title: Deficit Threat Drives Bond Yields Higher
item.description: Investors are betting a challenging fiscal situation might only get worse after the election.

item.title: Euro at Risk of Falling Due to Weak Eurozone Economy
item.description: The euro was weaker and remains at risk of falling given the eurozone’s challenging economic backdrop, MUFG Bank said, adding that Volkswagen’s plan t...

item.title: Brent Options Volatility Skew Shows Market Relief After Israel's Attack
item.description: The Brent options’ volatility skew has narrowed significantly since Israel spared Iran’s oil infrastructure, highlighting a broader market view of red...

item.title: Here’s what BlackRock’s Larry Fink says will be powering the stock market for years to come
item.description: The head of BlackRock says companies are growing into ‘extreme’ price-to-equity ratios.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise to Near Record Levels Ahead of U.S. Elections
item.description: Gold futures edged higher in Europe, maintaining its strength despite rising Treasury yields and slightly easing geopolitical tensions, Pepperstone sa...

item.title: These two ‘low-tax’ states are getting socked with fast-rising property taxes
item.description: Nationally, property taxes in major cities have gone up 30% since 2019, according to a new Redfin analysis.

item.title: HSBC shares surge on another $3 billion buyback plan and earnings beat
item.description: HSBC shares increased 4% on Tuesday as the British bank beat analysts’ earnings expectations for the third quarter and launched another $3 billion sha...
